1.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

2.text: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing: but righteousness delivereth from death.

3.text: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish: but he thrusteth away the desire of the wicked.

4.text: He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent maketh rich.

5.text: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

6.text: Blessings are upon the head of the righteous: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

7.text: The memory of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

8.text: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool shall fall.

9.text: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

10.text: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prating fool shall fall.

11.text: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life: but violence covereth the mouth of the wicked.

12.text: Hatred stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all transgressions.

13.text: In the lips of him that hath discernment wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

14.text: Wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is a present destruction.

15.text: The rich manâ€™s wealth is his strong city: the destruction of the poor is their poverty.

16.text: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life; the increase of the wicked to sin.

17.text: He is in the way of life that heedeth correction: but he that forsaketh reproof erreth.

18.text: He that hideth hatred is of lying lips; and he that uttereth a slander is a fool.

19.text: In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression: but he that refraineth his lips doeth wisely.

20.text: The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver: the heart of the wicked is little worth.

21.text: The lips of the righteous feed many: but the foolish die for lack of understanding.

22.text: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow therewith.

23.text: It is as sport to a fool to do wickedness: and so is wisdom to a man of understanding.

24.text: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: and the desire of the righteous shall be granted.

25.text: When the whirlwind passeth, the wicked is no more: but the righteous is an everlasting foundation.

26.text: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to them that send him.

27.text: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.

28.text: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness: but the expectation of the wicked shall perish.

29.text: The way of the LORD is a strong hold to the upright; but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

30.text: The righteous shall never be removed: but the wicked shall not dwell in the land.

31.text: The mouth of the righteous bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward tongue shall be cut off.

32.text: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable: but the mouth of the wicked speaketh frowardness.
